autonomy.description: Pride is self-reliance repeats Lucifer's original sin of wanting independence from God and fails to acknowledge our complete dependence on divine grace.

autonomy.question: Did you solely rely on your own abilities, neglecting to acknowledge God's role in your accomplishments?
autonomy.description: Pride is self-reliance repeats Lucifer's original sin of wanting independence from God and fails to acknowledge our complete dependence on divine grace.

extracted_data_phrases: through your words , actions , or presence in their life
scandal.question: Did you attempt to lead someone into a sinful act through your words, actions, or presence in their life?
scandal.description: Leading others to sin (also called "scandal") is sinful because it actively harms another person's soul by encouraging them away from God, making you spiritually responsible both for your own sin and for potentially damaging another's relationship with God.

scandal.question: Did I try to lead someone into sinful behavior through my actions?
scandal.description: Leading others to sin (also called "scandal") is sinful because it actively harms another person's soul by encouraging them away from God, making you spiritually responsible both for your own sin and for potentially damaging another's relationship with God.

impenitence.question: Have I obstinately refused to acknowledge my wrongdoing, stubbornly clinging to a particular sin without repentance?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

impenitence.question: Have I stubbornly refused to acknowledge my own wrongdoing, clinging to prideful excuses rather than seeking forgiveness from God?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

sloth.question: Have I neglected to provide guidance that would lead my child to know Christ, had they been present?
sloth.description: Parents have the duty to be the first teachers of faith to their children, as promised in their child's baptism and outlined in Church teaching as the fundamental responsibility of Christian parenthood.

sloth.question: Have I failed to cultivate my own spiritual life, which would allow me to more effectively guide my child towards Christ?

sloth.question: Have I neglected to be a spiritual guide to my child, leading them away from their faith in Christ?
sloth.description: Parents have the duty to be the first teachers of faith to their children, as promised in their child's baptism and outlined in Church teaching as the fundamental responsibility of Christian parenthood.

sloth.question: In what ways have I put my own interests ahead of genuine responsibilities to others in my life?
sloth.description: Neglecting family duties is considered sinful because it violates both divine law and natural law, where God entrusts us with specific responsibilities to nurture, protect, and care for our family members as part of our fundamental Christian vocation.

sloth.question: In what ways have I put my own desires ahead of my responsibilities to genuinely contribute to my community, even if that means sacrificing personal interests?
sloth.description: Neglecting family duties is considered sinful because it violates both divine law and natural law, where God entrusts us with specific responsibilities to nurture, protect, and care for our family members as part of our fundamental Christian vocation.

of spiritual ignorance or neglect in their faith development

sloth.description: Parents have a primary and sacred duty to pass on the faith to their children, as they are considered their children's first and most important religious teachers who are directly responsible for their spiritual formation and eternal salvation.

sloth.question: Did you neglect to prioritize daily communication with God?
sloth.description: This is a sin because daily prayer is our essential lifeline of communication with God - deliberately neglecting it demonstrates ingratitude to our Creator, breaks our fundamental relationship with Him, and violates the First Commandment's call to properly worship God

ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

greed.question: Did I make accumulation and possession of wealth a driving force in my life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

impiety.question: Did I fail to show reverence for the Most Blessed Sacrament in times when it was readily available or presented to me?

presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

presumption.question: Did you put off going to confession while in a state of sin, assuming that you would have time later to make amends?
presumption.description: Deliberately delaying confession while in mortal sin is a serious offense because it recklessly endangers your soul's salvation, shows contempt for God's mercy through the sacrament of reconciliation, and demonstrates prideful presumption that you'll have time later to repent.
